articles.headline: A Growing Chorus of Big City Prosecutors Say No to Marijuana Convictions
articles.snippet: Marlyn Mosby, Baltimore’s top prosecutor, says she will no longer prosecute marijuana possession cases and will vacate thousands of convictions. The police disagree.
articles.abstract: Marlyn Mosby, Baltimore’s top prosecutor, says she will no longer prosecute marijuana possession cases and will vacate thousands of convictions. The police disagree.
articles.lead_paragraph: BALTIMORE — Baltimore has both the highest murder rate among the nation’s big cities and one of the most broken relationships between its police and its citizenry. Only one out of four homicides were solved last year. And the city’s enforcement of marijuana laws has fallen almost exclusively on African-Americans.

articles.headline: The Lonely, and Often Risky, Pursuit of R. Kelly: ‘Where Was Everybody Else?’
articles.snippet: The work of Jim DeRogatis and Dream Hampton on the accusations against the R&B star began years apart. Now that it seems the public is listening, they have a sense of satisfaction — and security concerns.
articles.abstract: The work of Jim DeRogatis and Dream Hampton on the accusations against the R&B star began years apart. Now that it seems the public is listening, they have a sense of satisfaction — and security concerns.
articles.lead_paragraph: CHICAGO — For the journalists who have dug the deepest on R. Kelly, these should be satisfying days.

articles.headline: Apple Says Profits Were Flat, Citing Slump in China
articles.snippet: The iPhone maker, which reported quarterly earnings, faces a number of issues, from consumer demand in China to an unusual security bug in its iPhone software.
articles.abstract: The iPhone maker, which reported quarterly earnings, faces a number of issues, from consumer demand in China to an unusual security bug in its iPhone software.
articles.lead_paragraph: Apple said on Tuesday that profits were flat and revenues were down in its most recent quarter, indicating a difficult road ahead for a company that five months ago became the first American firm to be valued above $1 trillion.

articles.headline: Opposition Leader, and Oil, Become Focus of Venezuela-U.S. Struggle
articles.snippet: After Washington handed control of Venezuela’s assets in the United States to the opposition leader, the government of Nicolás Maduro struck back fiercely.
articles.abstract: After Washington handed control of Venezuela’s assets in the United States to the opposition leader, the government of Nicolás Maduro struck back fiercely.
articles.lead_paragraph: CARACAS, Venezuela — Reeling from American oil sanctions, President Nicolás Maduro’s government on Tuesday fought to keep its grip on Venezuela, opening an investigation into what it called the “violent acts” of the nation’s opposition leader, freezing his assets and barring him from leaving the country.
articles.byline: By Ana Vanessa Herrero and Clifford Krauss

articles.headline: A Growing Chorus of Republican Critics for Trump’s Foreign Policy
articles.snippet: More than two years into his administration, the disconnect between President Trump and the Republican establishment on foreign policy has rarely been as stark.
articles.abstract: More than two years into his administration, the disconnect between President Trump and the Republican establishment on foreign policy has rarely been as stark.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — They think pulling out of Syria and Afghanistan would be a debacle. They think North Korea cannot be trusted. They think the Islamic State is still a threat to America. They think Russia is bad and NATO is good.

articles.headline: A Merciless Cold Lingers in the Midwest
articles.snippet: A deep, brutal cold set in across the Midwest on Wednesday, sending temperatures plummeting to stunning depths. With the wind chill, it felt like minus 53 in Minneapolis.
articles.abstract: A deep, brutal cold set in across the Midwest on Wednesday, sending temperatures plummeting to stunning depths. With the wind chill, it felt like minus 53 in Minneapolis.
articles.lead_paragraph: For the latest developments, read our Thursday live briefing on the polar vortex here.
articles.byline: By Julie Bosman and Monica Davey

articles.headline: Is There Room in 2020 for a Centrist Democrat? Maybe One or Two
articles.snippet: A group of moderate Democrats, led by Joseph R. Biden and Michael Bloomberg, are thinking of challenging Trump. If too many centrists run, they could box each other out.
articles.abstract: A group of moderate Democrats, led by Joseph R. Biden and Michael Bloomberg, are thinking of challenging Trump. If too many centrists run, they could box each other out.
articles.lead_paragraph: Howard Schultz, the former Starbucks chief executive contemplating an independent run for president, stated it as a plain matter of fact: For someone with his views — a distinctly white-collar blend of conservative fiscal instincts and liberal social values — there is no suitable political party.

articles.headline: Fed Signals End of Interest Rate Increases
articles.snippet: The Federal Reserve said it expected continued growth but, in a sharp reversal, indicated it stood ready either to increase or to reduce rates, depending on economic conditions.
articles.abstract: The Federal Reserve said it expected continued growth but, in a sharp reversal, indicated it stood ready either to increase or to reduce rates, depending on economic conditions.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — In suspending its previous plans to continue raising rates this year, the Federal Reserve signaled that its march toward higher interest rates may be ending sooner than expected.

articles.headline: Does Facebook Really Know How Many Fake Accounts It Has?
articles.snippet: The social network has disclosed an estimate for years, but a closer look raises lots of questions.
articles.abstract: The social network has disclosed an estimate for years, but a closer look raises lots of questions.
articles.lead_paragraph: Facebook sells advertisers on its access to real people — 2.32 billion of them, a network that exceeds the populations of North America, South America and Africa combined.
